g.title: Sheet.31
g.desc: Metal-LB has two (three-ish) options. - BGP Mode requiring a ...
g.text: Metal-LB has two (three-ish) options. - BGP Mode requiring a BGP Peer (router or similar) that is able to exchange BGP routing messages. The oneshot sets k3s up in this mode and assumes you have a router (if not, try out VyOS!)- Layer 2 Mode requiring a IP in the same CIDR as your host and a real NIC in m ost cases. The current scripts doesn’t setup this up.We have two networks on our Host Machine as illustrated belowOAM – where K8s API runs and listens and main NICTRAFFIC – Where BGP is used to advertise Services that are deployed with ExternalLB types in k8s via MetalLB CNI

g.title: Sheet.38
g.desc: Basic K3s + Metal-lb Stack up Diagram
